data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Crystal-to-Crystal Guest Exchange of Large Organic Molecules within a 3D Coordination Network

data.question: Who are the authors of the article?
data.answer: Osamu Ohmori, Masaki Kawano, and Makoto Fujita

data.question: What is the DOI of the article?
What type of guest molecules were exchanged in the study?
What is the main finding of the study?
data.answer: Efficient inclusion of large guest molecules in the large channel of a 3D coordination network via single-crystal-to-single-crystal guest exchange.

data.question: What method was used to analyze the guest exchange/inclusion processes?
What was the effect of donor−acceptor interactions on the crystal color?
data.answer: The crystal color changed significantly due to the formation of charge-transfer complexes.

data.question: Did the inclusion of triphenylene (3a) cause a color change in the crystal?
data.answer: Yes, the crystal color turned pale yellow.

data.question: Was there a color change observed during the formation of the inclusion complex with triphenylphosphine oxide (3d)?
data.answer: No, no color change was observed.

data.question: Did the crystallographic analysis reveal aromatic stacking between the nonplanar guest of 3d and the ligand of 1?
data.answer: No, the analysis indicated the absence of aromatic stacking.

data.question: Is the guest exchange process reversible according to the UV−vis spectra?
data.answer: False, the guest exchange process was irreversible.

data.question: Did the inclusion complexes (4a-d) retain their crystallinity after the guest exchange?
data.answer: True, they retained their crystallinity without loss.

data.question: Can the inclusion complexes (4a-d) be obtained via one pot complexation of ZnI2 and 1 in the presence of 3a?
data.answer: False, they were obtained only via guest exchange.

data.question: Does the 3D net of 2 change after the inclusion of large guests?
Is the distance between 3a and 1 in positions B and C longer than the sum of van der Waals radii?
